In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Tim Woolworth <tjwool=
worth@...> wrote:
>
> Agreed, it is the best camera to get. There are sever=
al models available:
> some have built in IR lights, some have IR / UV ligh=
ts, some are set-up for
> sky watching, and others are just plain ol' full =
spectrum.
> 
> With this camera (depending on the model, a regular one with=
 the different
> options run around $120-150), you will also need the power=
 supply ($12-$20),
> a tripod, and a portable recorder. My group uses 2 of =
them and each one is
> attached to a portable DVD recorder that has a small=
 LCD screen, you can
> find these refurbished for under $100.
> 
> Tim
>
